content.description: Ascend the large slab on the left.On the face of Annulment Boulder, start on a crack with decent crimps and a high foot, and slowly work your way up on decent crimps and techy foot work. Top out about 3 feet to the left of the large pocket.
content.protection: A fall on this climb can be scary, and it would be a good idea to have at least two pads and a good spotter if you plan on attempting the topout.
content.location: It ascends a large, slab face on Annulment Boulder to the left of Go To The Corner! (V1).

content.description: This problem is a simple boulder problem which follows the arete of two adjoining boulders. The left boulder has a slight overhang adding a slight level of difficulty. Overall, this is an easy and enjoyable problem.
content.protection: A single mat and spotter should be plenty.
content.location: This small problem is directly to the left of Annulment (V5) on the same rock face. In relation to the large rock house, the problem is about 500 feet to the left of the cave.

content.description: On the face of the boulder closest to the rock house, start on the lip of the right arÃªte, climb up to the crack in the center of the face, and top out. Don't lose any ring fingers.
content.protection: It is fairly easy to protect with a couple pads and a spotter.
content.location: This is on the large boulder near the rock house, directly to the left when facing the main wall.

content.description: This boulder has a few good problems.
